content:
只是提供一些我的看法，for inspiration，假使万一你内耗：
我之前玩 NieR 的时候，里面有一些设定，绝对是继承了一个叫萨特的人的说法：自我是由我们对那些“关于我们”的事实的解释构成的，而这种解释一直在变。
所以，自我其实是一个至死方休、不断塑造的过程，直到行动和解释一起停止。
在这个框架下，自我就是不断选择、不断行动的过程：
兵来将挡，水来土掩，饿了吃饭，没钱赚钱，不爱就散，要鼓盆而歌。
所以，内耗其实没有直接的底层逻辑叭。
summary: 一些关于自我、内耗、行动的随想，来自 NieR 和萨特的启发。
title: 关于内耗的一点小想法

Book Recommendation: Dynamics in Enzyme Catalysis by Judith Klinman, Sharon Hammes-Schiffer
From late 2024 to early 2025, I read Dynamics in Enzyme Catalysis, a book composed of 8 collected papers discussing the role of dynamics in enzyme mechanisms, co-edited by two leading figures in the field: Judith Klinman and Sharon Hammes-Schiffer.
This book provides deep insights into how protein motions and dynamics contribute to catalysis, especially from a theoretical and experimental perspective, including quantum mechanical tunneling, transition state theory, and protein motions.
Download Links Version with my annotations and reading notes:
Download here
Clean version without annotations:
(Link to be added later)
DOI: https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-642-38962-7
If you are deeply interested in enzyme mechanisms, and especially in the role of protein dynamics and quantum chemistry in enzymology, this book is a unique and insightful resource.
summary: An advanced collection of papers exploring the role of dynamics in enzyme catalysis, co-edited by Judith Klinman and Sharon Hammes-Schiffer. Includes my annotated version and a clean copy for download.
title: Book Recommendation: Dynamics in Enzyme Catalysis

以前看过一个韩国人写的书，里面的观点是：在数字资本主义和社交媒体的驱动下，我们正逐渐进入一个以同质化、自我重复、信息过载为特征的社会。在这个社会中，真正的**“他者”**——那个与我们不同、能够对我们的思想产生冲击的存在——正在消失。
“在这个社会里，真正的‘他者’正在消失，那些能够挑战我们认知、让我们思考和成长的存在，正在被信息回音室和算法过滤。”
这个说法很有意思。
在和 ZGY 拉扯的时日里，我思考了很多，也越来越困惑，为什么这个人如此吸引着我？逻辑上讲不通。 但为了弄明白，我设想了一辈子和他在一起，结婚什么的都好。
而就在这样思考的时候，我惊异地发现，我是个存在主义者，甚至是有些积极的那种。
因为异国，因为内耗，因为争执，因为争执后又把对方放在心里脑子里。因为对方在心里脑子里，所以想要坚定，更惊异于这份情感的存在。
我发现，我无语伦比地赞同并喜欢上了萨特。
“自我只是我们对那些‘关于我们’的事实的解释，而这种解释一直在变。”
—— 让-保罗·萨特，《存在与虚无》
萨特批判了认为自我只是简单存在的理论，他称之为自欺。这是一种对个人责任的否弃，是一种试图佯称生活由事实性所规定的逃避，用它作为借口，拒绝承担自己对“你所是”和“你将要成为”的责任。
“人就是他的选择。”
—— 让-保罗·萨特
这是对自我创造的否定，甚至在尝试以前就已经放弃。
但存在主义的我，想要创造未来的我。
我也终于明白了，爱本身或许是不受理性支配的，但选择去爱、选择如何去爱，是我的自由。
ZGY 不是命运，而是偶然性的契机。
如果说最初的吸引是随机的，是生物本能，是上帝掷出的骰子，那我选择让它成为我的意义，让它塑造我的存在，让它成为我的人生选项。
所以，爱是我的选择。
idk，很神奇。
我找到了，或者说，创造了一个新的自己。ZGY 是引子，或许是进化？上帝？的馈赠吧。
当然，也是我的动物本性。
所以，我爱你。
这么多人中，我只想和你拥抱、亲吻，建立更深的羁绊。
Omg——所以你是我的自由，你是我的命运。
summary: 无趣的灵魂千篇一律，好看的皮囊形形色色
title: ZING

羁绊说断就断，便真个断了 —— 一阙古意长词 少年曾梦桃花开，软红一片春潮细。
江南雨暗，吴宫柳老，玉壶冰碎。
远道孤鸿，画楼空伫，旧愁难寄。
奈东风易老，人心易变，镜中影、无从系。
回首残阳未醉，望西楼、往事如灰砾。
剑啸长空，千山暮雪，半生尘泪。
冷月黄昏，鬼灯独照，客魂空翠。
叹世间万象，斩不断、最是别离意。
summary: 少年曾梦桃花开，软红一片春潮细。羁绊说断就断，便真个断了，一阙写尽别离之意。
title: 羁绊说断就断，便真个断了 —— 一阙古意长词

Keywords Kinase, Phosphorylation, Activation, Spine, Conformation
Reference DOI: 10.1073/pnas.0607656103
Notes This paper compares the surfaces of active and inactive serine/threonine and tyrosine kinases to identify conserved structural features that underlie kinase activation. By aligning and analyzing multiple kinases, they highlight a conserved set of 30 residues critical for activation, leading to a general model of kinase activation.
One of their key contributions is identifying a hydrophobic “spine”, a structural feature dynamically assembled in active kinases but disordered in inactive forms, which helps coordinate the kinase’s active state.
Pre-knowledge (Kinase Architecture Recap) N-lobe (N-terminal lobe): β-sheet rich, involved in ATP binding. C-lobe (C-terminal lobe): α-helix rich, responsible for substrate binding and catalysis. Key conformational motions: αC-helix reorientation and activation loop movement are crucial for activation. Kinases toggle between open/closed even when active. Critical motifs and elements: K72–E91 salt bridge stabilizes ATP binding. Glycine-rich loop positions γ-phosphate of ATP. DFG motif (Asp-Phe-Gly): coordinates Mg²⁺ and phosphate transfer. HRD motif (His-Arg-Asp) for substrate positioning. Magnesium-binding loop for Mg²⁺ coordination. Activation loop: phosphorylation site, triggers structural rearrangement. Main Findings 30 conserved residues identified across kinases, important for maintaining active conformation. Hydrophobic spine is a critical dynamic structure formed upon activation: Composed of L95, L106, Y164, F185, connecting N- and C-lobes. Present in 23 eukaryotic and prokaryotic kinases — a universal feature. Graph-theoretical method reveals key catalytic residues and previously underappreciated ones: Known: K72, D184 New: A70, L106, involved in critical hydrophobic stacking. Glycine Swing — A Mechanism for Inactivation The DFG glycine (G186) exhibits a conformational twist (glycine swing) when the kinase is inactive. G186 forms H-bond with K189 to help orient K189 — essential in active state. Upon dephosphorylation of T197, the activation loop destabilizes: DFG-out conformation occurs — glycine swing moves aspartate away from catalytic site. K189 flips away from catalytic center, disrupting active conformation. Activation Mechanism and Structural Insights Phosphorylation of T197 stabilizes the active site by anchoring key residues (R165, K189). L106 creates a critical hydrophobic connection with L95 and DFG-Phe, helping align αC-helix and DFG motif. Spine assembly is central to activation — links N- and C-lobes to allow controlled flexibility. Hydrophobic Interactions Hydrophobic pocket surrounds ATP (L49, F54, V57, etc.). Spine residues: L95, L106, Y164, F185 form a continuous stack stabilizing active conformation. L106’s role: overlooked before, connects αC-helix and DFG motif — key for coordinating activation loop and catalytic residues. Why it’s interesting Proposes a universal model for kinase activation based on spine assembly and glycine swing. Graph-theoretical approach gives a systematic way to identify functionally critical residues beyond sequence conservation. Provides a structural explanation for how phosphorylation induces stabilization of the active kinase. Highlights the glycine swing as a potential mechanism of switching between active/inactive states, which could be targeted in kinase drug design. Take-home message Kinase activation involves more than local changes; it reflects global reorganization coordinated by a hydrophobic spine.
Glycine swing and spine assembly are critical dynamic features enabling allosteric control and catalysis.
This study offers a framework to understand activation across kinases and may guide how we think about kinase inhibitors and mutation effects in diseases.
summary: Notes on 2006_PNAS paper exploring conserved structural mechanisms of kinase activation via surface comparison.
title: Surface Comparison Reveals Conserved Activation Mechanism in Protein Kinases

Keywords Kinase, PKA, Dynamics, Community, Allostery, Spine, Conformation, MD, DFG, Phosphorylation
Reference DOI: 10.1073/pnas.1418402111
Notes This paper takes a dynamic look at protein kinase A (PKA) by applying community analysis to molecular dynamics (MD) simulations. Instead of thinking about PKA as a rigid structure, they map how different parts of the kinase move together — essentially dividing the protein into “communities” of residues that share correlated motions.
Interestingly, these communities don’t always align with classical sequence or structural motifs. Some well-known motifs are split into different communities, suggesting that functionally, these regions behave in a more modular and dynamic way than static structures might imply.
What they did MD simulations of PKA under four different conditions:
Closed with ATP + 2 Mg²⁺ Closed with ATP + 1 Mg²⁺ Open with ATP + 1 Mg²⁺ Open without ATP/Mg²⁺ (apo) Used mutual information to identify residue-residue correlated motions.
Applied Girvan–Newman community detection to partition PKA into dynamic communities.
Key findings Nine distinct communities were identified in the active (ATP + 2 Mg²⁺) PKA. Each community contains ~40–60 residues, forming dynamic modules. Catalytic residues (K72, D166, N171, D184) are located in different communities, but still functionally connected — showing how function emerges from inter-community dynamics. Community structure is sensitive to ligands and conformational state — ATP and Mg²⁺ binding reorganize the communication network inside PKA. Allosteric communication pathways revealed by this analysis align with known hydrophobic spine architecture, and match mutagenesis data (e.g., mutations like E208-R280 disrupt key community interactions, affecting function/stability). Why it’s cool The idea of breaking a kinase into dynamic communities gives a new way to think about long-range communication and allosteric regulation. It shows that allosteric coupling isn’t just about static contacts, but about dynamic relationships that shift with ligands and conformation. Also, this method provides a framework to analyze disease mutations that affect distant sites — by seeing which community connections are altered. Take-home message Protein kinases like PKA aren’t just collections of static motifs; they’re networks of dynamically coupled communities that reshape depending on what’s bound. Thinking about kinases this way could help explain how distant mutations or ligand binding events modulate activity — and could be applied to other kinases.
summary: Notes on a 2014 PNAS paper analyzing PKA dynamics through community analysis.
title: Community Analysis of PKA: A Dynamic View of Kinase Architecture

content:
一直以来都没太在意自己名字的含义。叫“若琪”这么多年，早就习惯了，听起来还挺顺耳。但最近不知道怎么的，突然脑子一抽，想起“若琪”其实有点弱气——若隐若现，琪树成林，全是虚的，像雾像风，没啥钝感力，听起来像个白衣飘飘的女主角。
我爹是个少年&青年沉迷武侠小说的人：快意江湖，乐啊。他经常跟我谈起《小李飞刀》，也就是古龙那本《多情剑客无情剑》。书里有个叫林诗音的白衣女子，美、温柔、飘来飘去——就是那种典型的柔弱型女主。我现在猜我爹可能是那会儿审美上头了，才起了“若琪”这种名字。听上去确实也挺白衣飘飘的。
不过说起来，我小时候喜欢的是阿飞。冷、干脆、话少、刀快。至于那些女角色，说实话我都不太喜欢，甚至觉得有点装。那种“好看又悲情”的人设我欣赏不来，有点柔弱婊的意思。
所以现在再看“若琪”这两个字，突然有点出戏。以前觉得它文雅、空灵，现在只觉得它太飘了，抓不住分量。但同时我也知道，这个名字某种程度上是我爹青春的一种投射，是他年轻时对“美”的一种想象。我是他女儿，我继承了他的姓，也继承了这个他构想出来的“若琪”吧。
但或许，我长成了完全不是他想象中的样子吧，假如他曾那么想过的话lol。
title: 若 琪
